item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "Whenever I'm out-of-doors and find myself wanting to have a first-rate think, I fling myself down on my back, throw my arms and legs out so that I look like an asterisk, and gaze at the sky. " -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description:
"As I stood outside in Cow Lane, it occurred to me that Heaven must be a place where the library is open twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.
No ... eight days a week." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "I don't want to be married just to be married. I can't think of anything lonelier than spending the rest of my life with someone I can't talk to, or worse, someone I can't be silent with." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Men are more interesting in books than they are in real life." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "That's what I love about reading: one tiny thing will interest you in a book, and that tiny thing will lead you to another book, and another bit there will lead you onto a third book. It's geometrically progressive - all with no end in sight, and for no other reason than sheer enjoyment." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Reading good books ruins you for enjoying bad books." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer and Annie Barrow
item.description: "I love seeing the bookshops and meeting the booksellers-- booksellers really are a special breed. No one in their right mind would take up clerking in a bookstore for the salary, and no one in his right mind would want to own one-- the margin of profit is too small. So, it has to be a love of readers and reading that makes them do it-- along with first dibs on the new books." -- Mary Ann Shaffer and Annie Barrow

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer & Annie Barrows
item.description: "I think you learn more if you're laughing at the same time." -- Mary Ann Shaffer & Annie Barrows

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Elizabeth von Arnim
item.description: "Who can begin conventional amiability the first thing in the morning?" -- Elizabeth von Arnim

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "But you see, Meg, just because we don't understand doesn't mean that the explanation doesn't exist." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Inspiration usually comes during work rather than before it." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The very essence of romance is uncertainty." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Helen Simonson
item.description: "I believe there is a great deal too much mutual confession going on today, as if sharing one’s problems somehow makes them go away. All it really does, of course, is increase the number of people who have to worry about a particular issue." -- Helen Simonson

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "I gave her a partial smile and kept the rest of it for myself..." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "What intrigued me more than anything else was finding out the way in which everything, all of creation - all of it! - was held together by invisible chemical bonds, and I found a strange, inexplicable comfort in knowing that somewhere, even though we couldn't see it in our own world, there was a real stability." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description:
"The woman was putting her purse in the drawer and settling down behind the desk, and I realized I had never seen her before in my life. Her face was as wrinkled as one of those forgotten apples you sometimes find in the pocket of last year's winter jacket.
Yes?" she said, peering over her spectacles. They teach them to do that at the Royal Academy of Library Science." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "If you’re insinuating that my personal hygiene is not up to the same high standard as yours you can go suck my galoshes." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "You are good. But it is not enough just to be good. You must be good for something. You must contribute good to the world. The world must be a better place for your presence. And the good that is in you must be spread to others...." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "There is something wonderful about a book. We can pick it up. We can heft it. We can read it. We can set it down. We can think of what we have read. It does something for us. We can share great minds, great actions, and great undertakings in the pages of a book." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "Where there is great love, there are always miracles." -- Willa Cather
